thread.title: Soap spoilers: Hollyoaks water stunt, EastEnders reunion, Coronation Street threat, Emmerdale murder plan - Hollyoaks Soaps
thread.title_full: Soap spoilers: Hollyoaks water stunt, EastEnders reunion, Coronation Street threat, Emmerdale murder plan - Hollyoaks News - Soaps - Digital Spy

author: Sophie Dainty
title: Soap spoilers: Hollyoaks water stunt, EastEnders reunion, Coronation Street threat, Emmerdale murder plan - Hollyoaks Soaps
text: Trevor Royle's feud with the Roscoe family reignites in explosive style later this month as Hollyoaks celebrates its 20th anniversary.Jason Roscoe (Alfie Browne-Sykes) is responsible for stirring up the latest trouble when he warns Trevor that Robbie has been working undercover for the police to trap him.The teen betrays his twin brother out of jealousy, as he isn't pleased to see his girlfriend Holly Cunningham growing so close to Robbie (Charlie Wernham).When confronted by a furious Trevor, Robbie is forced to confess that he's also been working with the gangster's ex Grace Black so that she can run off with baby Curtis.Fearing Trevor's next move, Robbie is grateful for the chance to escape from the village when his older brother Freddie reveals that he'll be leaving with Mercedes McQueen and invites him to come along too.A terrified Robbie starts to say his goodbyes, but Trevor is out for blood and later gives chase when he spots Robbie, Jason and Freddie (Charlie Clapham) all heading off in a car together. © Lime PicturesTrevor chases Freddie, Robbie and Jason The dramatic chase comes to an abrupt halt when the road ahead is blocked, forcing the Roscoes to get out of the car and jump off a viaduct in a desperate attempt to escape Trevor, who is armed with a gun.As the Roscoes go plunging into the water below, a satisfied Trevor is convinced they're all dead and makes his way back to his car. © Lime PicturesThe Roscoes are relieved when Trevor slows down © Lime PicturesFreddie, Robbie and Jason get out the car and run © Lime PicturesTrevor catches up to the boys In reality, the Roscoes are all still very much alive but have been carried away by the current and are heading straight for a storm drain.The brothers get sucked in and are left trapped as water starts pouring in the drain rapidly. As the situation gets increasingly dangerous and lives are left on the line, who will survive? © Lime PicturesRobbie clings to safety in the water © Lime PicturesRobbie shouts for help © Lime PicturesRobbie and Freddie are separated in the water © Lime PicturesRobbie and Freddie both try to stay safe © Lime PicturesFreddie attempts to help his brothers © Lime PicturesThe current gets out of control © Lime PicturesJason gets sucked into a storm drain © Lime PicturesRobbie gets sucked into the storm drain Hollyoaks airs these scenes on Tuesday, October 20 at 6.30pm on Channel 4.Hollyoaks turns 20: What happened to the original cast from 1995?Hollyoaks: The net closes in on the Gloved Hand Killer in new autumn trailerHollyoaks spoilers: The Roscoes and Trevor will go to war in the 20th anniversary weekHollyoaks teases huge 20th anniversary week in exciting new trailerRead more Hollyoaks spoilers and newsOver on EastEnders, Kathy Beale will continue to reconnect with her estranged family when Ian arranges a surprise dinner for her.With Kathy (Gillian Taylforth) back in the Square, a delighted Ian decides to organise a surprise meal so that she can see Dot Branning and Martin Fowler for the first time since her return. As Ian makes his plans, he remains unaware that Kathy is actually planning to flee with her other son Ben Mitchell in a bid to protect Phil, who is still missing.Ben and Kathy are persisting with their plan to leave Walford, but Kathy gets more than she bargained for when an oblivious Ian turns up with Dot and Martin to announce his dinner plans.Kathy is left feeling guiltier than ever when Dot shares some home truths with her once they are alone. Will Kathy still follow through with her plan to leave with Ben? © BBCIan arranges a family dinner © BBCDot and Martin spend time with Kathy EastEnders airs these scenes on Monday, October 19 at 8pm on BBC One.EastEnders spoilers: Ben and Kathy team up when Gavin demands cashEastEnders boss: Phil Mitchell kidnapping will take him in a whole new direction'Read more EastEnders spoilers and newsComing up on Coronation Street, Steph Britton's nightmare will begin as she becomes the victim of a 'revenge porn' scandal. The storyline sees Steph's ex-boyfriend Jamie (James Atherton) threaten to expose some personal pictures of her unless her brother Luke cooperates with his demands.When Jamie calls into the garage and tells Luke (Dean Fagan) that he has put him down for a track race on Saturday, he is cross when Luke refuses due to a promise he made to his girlfriend Maria Connor. © ITVJamie is furious when Luke backs out of the race However, as a desperate Jamie tells Luke that he needs cash from the race to clear his mounting debts, Luke is aghast when Jamie shows him some old photos of a scantily-clad Steph on his phone.Jamie threatens to make the pictures public unless Luke cooperates and goes ahead with the race. What will Luke do? © ITVJamie shows Luke personal photos of Steph © ITVLuke loses his temper with Jamie © ITVWill Luke give in to Jamie's demands? Coronation Street airs these scenes on Monday, October 19 at 7.30pm and 8.30pm on ITV.Coronation Street spoilers: Maria Connor will threaten to dump Luke Britton over his racingCoronation Street spoilers: Steph Britton targeted in revenge porn storylineRead more Coronation Street spoilers and newsMeanwhile, Robert Sugden's life will rest in Cain Dingle's hands on Emmerdale as he threatens to cut the villain's oxygen tube.Cain (Jeff Hordley) comes up with the shocking plan of action after his nephew Aaron Livesy has been arrested for Robert's recent shooting.Determined to save Aaron from a long prison sentence by shifting suspicion elsewhere, Cain recruits Adam Barton to help him kill Robert and ensure that Chrissie takes the fall for it.Adam is shocked by the scheme and shares his concerns with Cain's father Zak, but a determined Cain prepares to go ahead with his plan as he hides himself from the hospital CCTV with a large teddy.After Cain distracts a nurse, he snatches a cordless phone from reception and lures Chrissie into his trap by making a bogus call 'from the hospital' and getting her to come in.However, as Cain prepares to cut Robert's oxygen tube, he is stopped in his tracks when Zak arrives suddenly and interrupts him. Can Zak talk him out of it, or will Cain's determination to save his family spell the end for Robert? © ITVCain prepares to cut Robert's oxygen tube © ITVWill Cain kill Robert? Emmerdale airs these scenes on Wednesday, October 21 at 7pm on ITV. Emmerdale spoilers: Aaron Livesy will be arrested in Robert Sugden's shooting caseEmmerdale spoilers: Chrissie Sugden makes a move on Rakesh KotechaEmmerdale spoilers: Chas Dingle is left terrified by a mystery stalkerEmmerdale reveals airdate and time for Robert Sugden rewind episodeRead more Emmerdale spoilers and newsOver on Doctors, pregnant Emma Reid books an emergency medical appointment when she worries about her unborn baby.The scare comes just when Emma (Dido Miles) and her partner Howard Bellamy finally end up on the same page with their family plans.With Emma excited at the chance of doing all the things she missed out on with her son Chris, she excitedly chats to Howard about the future and all of the baby classes they can attend.Unfortunately, the day takes a worrying turn when Emma suddenly starts experiencing unexpected pains. Emma heads straight for a check-up with midwife Ruhma, but will everything be okay? © BBCEmma goes for an emergency check-up Doctors airs these scenes on Thursday, October 22 at 1.45pm on BBC One.Read more Doctors spoilers and newsHollyoaks was the winner of our storyline poll last week as 26% of you chose John Paul's career crisis as the best plot.Emmerdale was second with 25% for Jai's health scare, while Coronation Street claimed third spot with 24% for Sarah confiding in Billy.EastEnders managed fourth with 21% for Fatboy and Donna's kiss, while Doctors had the remaining 4% for Ayesha reporting Hayden.Don't forget to vote in our poll below and let us know which storyline looks best this week!Digital Spy Soap Scoop video - hit play below for gossip on Ben and Kathy's EastEnders reunion, Aaron's Emmerdale arrest, important news for Fiz and Tyrone in Coronation Street and a shock kidnapping in Hollyoaks. function onTemplateLoaded(experienceID) { bcExp = brightcove.getExperience(experienceID);
